title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
OB: When using Build 20011106, the new class wizard does not get the context right for nested classes. Specifically, when a .java file is open in the editor and the new class button is clicked, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard should default to the current type in the editor when a .java file is open.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Open a .java file in the editor. 2. Click the new class button. 3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard. It should be blank, but it should default to the current type in the editor.
